questions_with_visuals.subject: Mathematics
questions_with_visuals.question_text: What fraction of this shape is shaded?

working.step_2: Count shaded parts: 3 parts are shaded

questions_with_visuals.curriculum_reference: KS2 Mathematics - Fractions - recognise, name and write fractions

question_visual.alt_text: A rectangle divided into 8 equal parts, with 3 parts shaded blue

explanation_visual.svg_code: <svg viewBox='0 0 320 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><text x='10' y='20' font-size='14' font-weight='bold'>Step-by-step:</text><rect x='10' y='35' width='37.5' height='40' fill='#3B82F6' stroke='#1E40AF'/><rect x='47.5' y='35' width='37.5' height='40' fill='#3B82F6' stroke='#1E40AF'/><rect x='85' y='35' width='37.5' height='40' fill='#3B82F6' stroke='#1E40AF'/><rect x='122.5' y='35' width='37.5' height='40' fill='#E5E7EB' stroke='#6B7280'/><rect x='160' y='35' width='37.5' height='40' fill='#E5E7EB' stroke='#6B7280'/><rect x='197.5' y='35' width='37.5' height='40' fill='#E5E7EB' stroke='#6B7280'/><rect x='235' y='35' width='37.5' height='40' fill='#E5E7EB' stroke='#6B7280'/><rect x='272.5' y='35' width='37.5' height='40' fill='#E5E7EB' stroke='#6B7280'/><text x='60' y='90' font-size='12'>3 shaded</text><text x='200' y='90' font-size='12'>8 total</text><text x='140' y='90' font-size='16'>→ 3/8</text></svg>
explanation_visual.alt_text: Visual showing 3 shaded parts out of 8 total equals 3/8
explanation_visual.caption: Count the shaded parts (numerator) and total parts (denominator)

questions_with_visuals.subject: Mathematics

questions_with_visuals.curriculum_reference: KS2 Mathematics - Number and Place Value - use negative numbers in context, calculate intervals across zero

explanation_visual.alt_text: Number line showing a jump from -4 to 5, crossing zero, with an arc labeled +9°C

questions_with_visuals.subject: Mathematics
questions_with_visuals.question_text: Find the missing angle x in the triangle.

working.step_1: Angles in a triangle sum to 180°

questions_with_visuals.curriculum_reference: KS2 Mathematics - Properties of Shapes - know angles in a triangle sum to 180°

question_visual.alt_text: Triangle with angles: 72° at B, 53° at C, and unknown angle x at A

explanation_visual.svg_code: <svg viewBox='0 0 400 120' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='5' y='5' width='390' height='110' fill='#F8FAFC' rx='8'/><text x='20' y='30' font-size='14' font-weight='bold' fill='#1E40AF'>Solution:</text><text x='20' y='55' font-size='13' fill='#374151'>Angles in a triangle = 180°</text><text x='20' y='80' font-size='13' fill='#374151'>x + 72° + 53° = 180°</text><text x='20' y='105' font-size='13' fill='#374151'>x = 180° - 72° - 53° = </text><text x='215' y='105' font-size='14' font-weight='bold' fill='#22C55E'>55°</text><polygon points='300,20 260,100 340,100' fill='none' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='2'/><text x='300' y='45' font-size='11' fill='#22C55E' text-anchor='middle'>55°</text><text x='270' y='95' font-size='10' fill='#374151'>72°</text><text x='325' y='95' font-size='10' fill='#374151'>53°</text></svg>
explanation_visual.caption: All three angles must add up to exactly 180°

questions_with_visuals.subject: Mathematics
questions_with_visuals.question_text: The bar chart shows the number of books read by students. How many more books did Class A read than Class C?
questions_with_visuals.curriculum_reference: KS2 Mathematics - Statistics - interpret and construct bar charts

question_visual.alt_text: Bar chart showing: Class A: 45 books, Class B: 32 books, Class C: 28 books, Class D: 38 books

explanation_visual.svg_code: <svg viewBox='0 0 350 80' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='5' y='5' width='340' height='70' fill='#FEF3C7' rx='8' stroke='#F59E0B'/><text x='20' y='30' font-size='14' fill='#92400E'>Class A: <tspan font-weight='bold'>45</tspan> books</text><text x='180' y='30' font-size='14' fill='#92400E'>Class C: <tspan font-weight='bold'>28</tspan> books</text><text x='20' y='55' font-size='14' fill='#92400E'>Difference: 45 - 28 = <tspan font-weight='bold' fill='#059669'>17 books</tspan></text></svg>
explanation_visual.alt_text: Calculation: Class A (45) minus Class C (28) equals 17 books
explanation_visual.caption: Read the values carefully from the chart, then subtract

questions_with_visuals.subject: Mathematics

working.step_1: Find common denominator: LCM of 3 and 8 = 24

questions_with_visuals.curriculum_reference: KS2 Mathematics - Fractions - compare and order fractions whose denominators are multiples

question_visual.alt_text: Two fraction bars showing 2/3 (16/24) is slightly larger than 5/8 (15/24)

explanation_visual.svg_code: <svg viewBox='0 0 400 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><text x='10' y='25' font-size='14' font-weight='bold'>Step 1: Find common denominator</text><text x='20' y='50' font-size='13'>LCM of 3 and 8 = 24</text><text x='10' y='80' font-size='14' font-weight='bold'>Step 2: Convert fractions</text><text x='20' y='105' font-size='13'>2/3 = 16/24</text><text x='150' y='105' font-size='13'>5/8 = 15/24</text><rect x='250' y='85' width='64' height='25' fill='#3B82F6' rx='3'/><text x='282' y='103' font-size='12' fill='white' text-anchor='middle'>16/24</text><rect x='320' y='85' width='60' height='25' fill='#F59E0B' rx='3'/><text x='350' y='103' font-size='12' fill='white' text-anchor='middle'>15/24</text><text x='10' y='140' font-size='14' font-weight='bold'>Result: <tspan fill='#3B82F6'>2/3</tspan> > <tspan fill='#F59E0B'>5/8</tspan> because 16 > 15</text></svg>
explanation_visual.alt_text: Step by step: Convert to common denominator 24. 2/3 becomes 16/24, 5/8 becomes 15/24. Since 16 > 15, 2/3 is larger.
explanation_visual.caption: Convert to the same denominator, then compare numerators
